alert.note: Alert for Fairfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 6:11PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is indicated by the river gauge at the Still River in Brookfield. * WHERE...A portion of southern Connecticut in Northern Fairfield County, along the Still River basin in Brookfield. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 605 PM EDT, Gauge reports elevated indicated heavy rain earlier. In response this may cause minor small stream flooding in the vicinity of the Still River at Brookfield. - Along the Still River at Brookfield is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience stream related flooding along the Still River include... Danbury, Bethel, Brookfield and New Fairfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
